translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions in Triads🔽The Chapter on the Conditions in Triads

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽21.51. Saññojanādichagocchaka, Sanidassanattika🔽Nosaññojanaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nosaññojano sanidassanasappaṭigho🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. (Tīṇi pañhā. Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā🔽tīṇi …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Noganthaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nogantho sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  saññojana ādi chaga ucchaka sani dassana ttika  no saññojanam na sanidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca no saññojanaḥ sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi pañhā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā  tīṇi pe vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi  nogantham na sanidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca noganthaḥ sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: The Chapter on the Conditions in Triads

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nooghaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noogho sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi 🔽noogham na sanidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca nooghaḥ sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta 🔽hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to a non-fetter, non-object-of-consciousness, non-obstacle, non-hindrance, non-stainer, non-delusion, non-warp, non-bond, non-covering up, non-defilement, non-warp of mind, non-warp of the mind’s objects, non-corruption, non-stain, non-taint, non-defilement, non-muddiness, non-turbidity, non-disturbance, non-agitation, non-violence, non-affliction, non-burning, non-fever, non-obstruction, non-obliquity, non-crookedness, non-darkness, non-blindness, non-ignorance, non-non-knowing, non-non-penetration, non-non-seeing, non-non-knowing-and-seeing, non-non-cognisance, non-non-contemplation, non-non-investigation, non-non-enlightenment, non-non-full-understanding, non-non-abandoning, non-non-realising, non-non-developing, non-non-attainment, non-non-accomplishment, non-non-arising, non-non-production, non-non-origin, non-non-occurrence, non-non-manifestation, non-non-appearance, non-non-arising-again, non-non-reappearance, non-non-re-arising, non-non-re-occurrence, non-non-re-manifestation, non-non-re-appearance, non-non-re-arising-again, non-non-reappearance, non-non-re-arising, non-non-re-occurrence, non-non-re-manifestation, non-non-re-appearance, non-non-re-arising-again, non-non-reappearance, non-non-re-arising, non-non-re-occurrence, non-non-re-manifestation, non-non-re-appearance, non-non-re-arising-again, non-non-reappearance, non-non-re-arising

original: Noyogaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noyogo sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: no yogam na sanidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca no yogaḥ sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a non-adherent, non-evident, non-impacting dhamma, a non-adherent, evident, impacting dhamma arises. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to cause there are three, with respect to predominance there are three, … with respect to nutriment there is one, … with respect to disconnection there are three.

original: Nonīvaraṇaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nonīvaraṇo sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: no nīvaraṇam na sa nidassana sa paṭigham dhammam paṭicca no nīvaraṇaḥ sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: Dependent on a non-hindrance, non-evident, non-impacting dhamma, a non-hindrance, evident, impacting dhamma arises. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to cause there are three, with respect to predominance there are three, … with respect to nutriment there is one, … with respect to disconnection there are three.

original: Noparāmāsaṁ nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noparāmāso sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na uparāmāsam na sanidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na uparāmāsaḥ sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: Dependent on a non-clinging, non-evident, non-impacting dhamma, a non-clinging, evident, impacting dhamma arises. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to cause there are three, with respect to predominance there are three, … with respect to nutriment there is one, … with respect to disconnection there are three.
